metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Website Layout
Website Layout
A website is often divided into headers, menus, content and a footer:
content.html: A website is often divided into headers, menus, content and a footer:

content.text: There are tons of different layout designs to choose from. However, the structure above, is one of the most common, and we will take a closer look at it in this tutorial.
content.html: There are tons of different layout designs to choose from. However, the structure above, is one of the most common, and we will take a closer look at it in this tutorial.

content.text: Header
A header is usually located at the top of the website (or right below a top navigation menu). It often contains a logo or the website name:
content.html: A header is usually located at the top of the website (or right below a top navigation menu). It often contains a logo or the website name:

content.code_html:
.header {
  background-color: #F1F1F1;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 20px;
}

content.text: Navigation Bar
A navigation bar contains a list of links to help visitors navigating through your website:
content.html: A navigation bar contains a list of links to help visitors navigating through your website:

content.code_html:
/* The navbar container */
.topnav {
  overflow: hidden;
  background-color: #333;
}

/* Navbar links */
.topnav a {
  float: left;
  display: block;
  color: #f2f2f2;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
}

/* Links - change color on hover */
.topnav a:hover {
  background-color: #ddd;
  color: black;
}

content.text: Content
The layout in this section, often depends on the target users. The most common layout is one (or combining them) of the following:
content.html: The layout in this section, often depends on the target users. The most common layout is one (or combining them) of the following:

content.text: 1-column:
content.html: 1-column:

content.text: 2-column:
content.html: 2-column:

content.text: 3-column:
content.html: 3-column:

content.text: We will create a 3-column layout, and change it to a 1-column layout on smaller screens:
content.html: We will create a 3-column layout, and change it to a 1-column layout on smaller screens:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Create three equal columns that float next to each other */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Create three equal columns that float next to each other */

content.code_html:
/* Create three equal columns that float next to each other */
.column {
  float: left;
  width: 33.33%;
}

/* Clear floats after the columns */
.row:after {
  content: "";
  display: table;
  clear: both;
}

/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other on smaller screens (600px wide or less) */
@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
  .column {
    width: 100%;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Create three equal columns that float next to each other */

content.text: Tip: To create a 2-column layout, change the width to 50%. To create a 4-column layout, use 25%, etc.
content.html: Tip: To create a 2-column layout, change the width to 50%. To create a 4-column layout, use 25%, etc.

links.text:
Read more about 
it in our CSS Media Queries chapter

content.text: Tip: Do you wonder how the @media rule works? Read more about it in our CSS Media Queries chapter .
content.html: Tip: Do you wonder how the @media rule works? Read more about it in our CSS Media Queries chapter.

content.text: Tip: A more modern way of creating column layouts, is to use CSS Flexbox. However, it is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions. If you require IE6-10 support, use floats (as shown above). To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter .
content.html:
Tip: A more modern way of creating column layouts, is to use CSS Flexbox. However, it is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions. If you require IE6-10 support, use floats (as shown above).

To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter.

content.text: Unequal Columns
The main content is the biggest and the most important part of your site.
content.html: The main content is the biggest and the most important part of your site.

content.text: It is common with unequal column widths, so that most of the space is reserved for the main content. The side content (if any) is often used as an alternative navigation or to specify information relevant to the main content. Change the widths as you like, only remember that it should add up to 100% in total:
content.html: It is common with unequal column widths, so that most of the space is reserved for the main content. The side content (if any) is often used as an alternative navigation or to specify information relevant to the main content. Change the widths as you like, only remember that it should add up to 100% in total:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes 
   the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes 
   the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.code_html:
.column {
  float: left;
}

/* Left and right column */
.column.side {
  width: 25%;
}

/* Middle column */
.column.middle {
  width: 50%;
}

/* Responsive layout - makes the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */
@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
  .column.side, .column.middle {
    width: 100%;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Responsive layout - makes 
   the three columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.text: Footer
The footer is placed at the bottom of your page. It often contains information like copyright and contact info:
content.html: The footer is placed at the bottom of your page. It often contains information like copyright and contact info:

content.code_html:
.footer {
  background-color: #F1F1F1;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 10px;
}

content.text: Responsive Website Layout
By using some of the CSS code above, we have created a responsive website layout, which varies between two columns and full-width columns depending on screen width:
content.html: By using some of the CSS code above, we have created a responsive website layout, which varies between two columns and full-width columns depending on screen width:

content.text: Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: Ever heard about W3Schools Spaces ? Here you can create your website from scratch or use a template, and host it for free.
content.html: Ever heard about W3Schools Spaces? Here you can create your website from scratch or use a template, and host it for free.

content.html: * no credit card required
